thread.title: News24.com | 3 die in North West floods
thread.title_full: News24.com | 3 die in North West floods

title: News24.com | 3 die in North West floods
text:
3 die in North West floods 2017-02-23 06:04 Jeanette Chabalala, News24 Paramedics were kept busy after attending to several reports of flooded roads. (Supplied) WATCH: Dramatic footage shows floods sweeping through SA 2017-02-22 10:35 
Flood warnings have been issued for the eastern parts of Eastern Cape, southern KwaZulu-Natal, the southern and western parts of the Free State and eastern Northern Cape, and Johannesburg and its surrounding areas. WATCH What To Read Next ALERT: Northern parts of SA on flood watch following heavy rains in Joburg 
Rustenburg – Flash floods in North West have killed at least three people, North West Premier Supra Mahumapelo said on Wednesday. 
A primary school boy drowned while trying to cross a stream in Leporung, near Makgobistad village, and two people died in Lemenong, Phokeng, when their car was swept away this week, he said in a statement. 
Areas affected by floods include Ratlou, Kagisano-Molopo, Greater Taung, Ramotshere Moiloa, Mahikeng, and the Moses Kotane, Rustenburg, Maquassi Hills, and Matlosana local municipalities. 
Provincial government officials were being sent to assess the damage the rain had caused. 
“Our thoughts and prayers are with all the families during this sad time. We send our sincere sympathies to the families of the deceased,” Mahumapelo said. Read more on: mahikeng | weather | floods Join the conversation!
